meanings.sent1: The anemophilous flowers release pollen that is carried by the wind.
meanings.sent2: Anemophilous plants rely on the wind to spread their pollen.
meanings.sent3: The anemophilous dandelion seeds danced in the breeze like tiny ballerinas.
meanings.sent4: The anemophilous pine trees whispered secrets to the wind as it carried their pollen far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The anemophilous nature of the grass was evident as the wind painted the fields yellow with pollen.

meanings.definition: Relating to plants that are pollinated by wind.
meanings.sent1: The anemophilous characteristics of certain trees make them less attractive to bees.
meanings.sent2: Anemophilous plants do not rely on insects for pollination.
meanings.sent3: The anemophilous oak tree joked with the bees, saying, 'I don't need your help!'
meanings.sent4: The anemophilous nature of the willow tree made it stand out among the other flowering plants.
meanings.sent5: The anemophilous maple tree stood tall, letting the wind do the work of pollination for it.
